definition: yangqin/dulcimer (hammered string musical instrument)
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
variant of 揚|扬[yang2]
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither

sentences.english: Most makes me arrogantly is, I will have one pair to become the future dulcimer hand.
sentences.chinese: 最令我骄傲的是，我有一双成为未来扬琴家的手。

sentences.english: The dulcimer to me is in the life an essential part.
sentences.chinese: 扬琴对我来说是生命中不可缺少的一部分。

sentences.english: Had solved these problems, can improve the efficiency of dulcimer study greatly.
sentences.chinese: 解决好这些新问题，可以大大提高扬琴学习的效率。

sentences.english: The utility model belongs to the technical field of orchestra instruments and discloses a cymbalo.
sentences.chinese: 本实用新型属于管弦乐器技术领域，公开了一种扬琴。

sentences.english: I found the harp and very similar to my personality, good has a flat.
sentences.chinese: 我发现扬琴与我的个性极其相似，都有着平淡的优秀。

definition: zhongruan or alto lute, like pipa 琵琶 but bigger and lower range
zither or guzheng/large zither with 13 to 25 strings, developed from guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] during Tang and Song times
erhu (Chinese 2-string fiddle)/alto fiddle/CL:把[ba3]
plucked string music
a bowed stringed instrument with a thin wooden soundboard
musical instrument/CL:件[jian4]
jinghu, a smaller, higher-pitched erhu 二胡 (two-stringed fiddle) used to accompany Chinese opera/also called 京二胡
(Western) concert flute
liuqin lute, smaller version of the pipa 琵琶, with holes in the soundbox, and range similar to that of a violin
cello/violoncello/CL:把[ba3]
string instrument
clarinet
sanxian, large family of 3-stringed plucked musical instruments, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and long neck, used in folk music, opera and Chinese orchestra
hulusi, aka cucurbit flute (a kind of free reed wind instrument)
sax/saxophone
fiddle/violin
